attachments.title: Fix the bug of marketplace name must be unique by feihujiang · Pull Request #19 · hyperledger/sawtooth-core · GitHub
attachments.text: Signed-off-by: feihujiang <mailto:jiangfeihu@huawei.com|jiangfeihu@huawei.com> Here checks that names must be unique, but when transactions apply, the store don't bind name to the transaction identifier, this is a bug. This PR...

text: Reviews of anyone are welcome.

<@U0YQQRNU8> The MarketPlaceTransaction has no check_valid() itself,  so the LocalValidation of forward_page using check_valid() is useless for the MarketPlaceTransaction,  we should refractioning is_valid() to check_valid() for the MarketPlaceTransaction, what's your point?
I'm having trouble using the web api to talk to the validator(localhost). Is this a problem with the config file in /docs/tutorial/
docs/source/tutorial/txnvalidator.js
<@U231CKQH2>  I will double check the current validator config file there. Could you give me the complete path to the tutorial you are using?
E.g. is it: <https://github.com/IntelLedger/sawtooth-core/blob/master/docs/source/tutorial/txnvalidator.js> ?

attachments.title: IntelLedger/sawtooth-core
attachments.text: Contribute to sawtooth-core development by creating an account on GitHub.

text: <@U1V9UML9E> Hey todo, here is the full path: /project/sawtooth-core/docs/source/tutorial/txnvalidator.js.
<@U231CKQH2>  Thanks. Let me take a look, and get back to you. Did you modify the file at all?
<@U1V9UML9E> I changed the http port to 8900 and back to 8800 but nothing else
<@U27B43WCS|steph_h> has joined the channel
having the same problem as <@U231CKQH2>
<@U2614J1A5|denis.polish> has left the channel

<@U231CKQH2>  and <@U251ZDKJ5>  are you attempting to reach the web api from the same host running the validator, or from a different machine (e.g. the machine hosting the VM running the validtor, etc.?)
running the validator VM on the same machine as the web server
everything is running locally on one machine
Are you trying to pull data from the web API on blocks/transactions? or are you submitting a transaction to the validator?
<@U231CKQH2>  and <@U251ZDKJ5>  Are you able to run this command from the actual vagrant linux vm:
curl -i -X GET <http://localhost:8800/store/EndpointRegistryTransaction/*>
<@U1V9UML9E> i know sometime there are issues exposing the ports in the VM outside of it

The way that the validator config file is configured in the tutorial config file, and the way the Vagrant config is configured, it is probably not possible to hit the Web API from any other machine than the localhost running the validator. If that makes sense....
You can change the validator config to cause the validator to listen to requests from other hosts, however. This is not really supported as part of the tutorial. :slightly_smiling_face:

<@U1ZUSJHAA> - in mktplace, we should remove is_valid and in favor of check_valid.  it's a bit involved since everywhere is_valid returns False, check_valid will have to instead throw a good error message.  That would be a very nice enhancement to mktplace.
<@U0N3AJSSU> I'm trying to build a wallet service based on django/python and was wondering if we could have early access to the JS framework
<@U1V9UML9E> I get  'Failed to connect to localhost port 8800: Connection refused' from within the vm
<@U1V9UML9E> When I run 'curl -i -X GET <http://localhost:8800/store/EndpointRegistryTransaction/*>'
<@U231CKQH2> how about netstat -l
<@U231CKQH2> Please try this command:
netstat -an | grep LISTEN
(sorry for delay - was dealing with a car repair issue. :disappointed: )
If you run that command, you should get something like:
You should have a "tcp LISTEN" line like that, but for the numeral port that your validator config file is telling the validator to listen on.
If you do not, the validator is not up and listening
<@U231CKQH2> : also run this command in your vagrant environment:
ps -ef | grep python
if the validator is running, you will see a response something like this:
vagrant   9434  9239  2 Aug31 pts/2    00:36:20 python ./bin/txnvalidator -v --config /project/sawtooth-core/docs/source/txn_family_tutorial/txnvalidator.js

I am running a validator node on the VM and I can successfully run 'curl -i -X GET <http://localhost:8800/store/EndpointRegistryTransaction/*>' from within the the VM. But on my host machine when I run the same command I get an empty response.
I think you may need to map the ports
<https://www.vagrantup.com/docs/networking/forwarded_ports.html>

attachments.title: Forwarded Ports - Networking - Vagrant by HashiCorp
attachments.text: Vagrant forwarded ports allow you to access a port on your host machine andhave all data forwarded to a port on the guest machine, over either TCP orUDP.
attachments.fallback: Forwarded Ports - Networking - Vagrant by HashiCorp

text: let me get one of our guys in here
hold on a moment
I am using the vagrant file included in the sawtooth-core/tools directory. It seems that the forwarded ports are already set up.
I think there is one more step
<@U14JXLCLF>
The ports seem to already be forwarded to 8800 and 8900 in the vagrantfile
ah ok, I'll let Cian comment, I know he had some thoughts on one more step that may be required
<@U14JXLCLF> Thanks for helping with this.
Could that be adding the auto_correct param?
<@U231CKQH2> what is the Listen entry in your txnvalidator.js set to?

"localhost:5500/UDP gossip",
"localhost:8800/TCP http"
same as <@U27B43WCS>
you need to change it to  "0.0.0.0:8800/TCP http"
so it will bind to the http to all the intefaces including the vagrant host interface
solved, awesome
thanks!
<@U14JXLCLF>  Thanks.  We should note this in our public docs somewhere. I will determine where.
yup thanks this was helpful!
Glad that worked for everyone, let us know if you have any more questions
